fields.value: The Impact of Consulting Services on Small and Medium Enterprises: Evidence from a Randomized Trial in Mexico

dsDescriptionValue.value: Using a randomized evaluation with 432 Mexican small and medium enterprises, we show that access to management consulting had positive effects on total factor productivity and return-on-assets (about 0.2 standard deviations, relative to the control group). Owners also had significant increase in “entrepreneurial spirit” (an index that measures entrepreneurial confidence and goal setting). Using Mexican social security data, we find a persistent large increase (about 50%) in the number of employees and total wage bill even five years after the program. We document large heterogeneity in the specific managerial practices that improved as a result of the consulting, but the three most prominent areas are marketing, financial accounting, and long-term business planning.

grantNumberAgency.value: The Government of the State of Puebla via the Consejo para el Desarrollo Industrial, Comercial y de Servicios
Knowledge for Change trust fund of the World Bank
Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation via the Financial Access Initiative

fields.value: Research Support, Innovations for Poverty Action

value: Businesses formally registered with the government and paying taxes.

fields.value: Innovations for Poverty Action and SIMO Consulting

Out of the 432 businesses enrolled in the study, 150 were randomly selected to participate in the program by a Stata program run in the presence of government officials and a public notary at the Puebla Institute for Competitive Productivity (IPPC). The randomization was stratified by sector (manufacturing, services, and commerce) and enterprise size (micro, small, and medium).

Surveyors set up times to interview businesses over the phone and then conducted in-person interviews. If a business was not reachable by phone, surveyors would attempt to reach them in person. In the second endline, difficulty reaching businesses led the consulting firm to conduct a limited number of interviews over the phone.
